historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 19-86, see notes under ยง 15-361.

Uniform Law:

This section is based on ยง 3 of the Uniform Foreign-Country Money Judgments Recognition Act. See Vol. 13, Part II, Uniform Laws Annotated, Master Edition or ULA Database on Westlaw.

DC CODE ยง 15-363

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: Except as otherwise provided in subsection (b) of this section, this subchapter applies to a foreign-country judgment to the extent that the judgment:
Grants or denies recovery of a sum of money; and
Under the law of the foreign country where rendered, is:
This subchapter does not apply to a foreign-country judgment, even if the judgment grants or denies recovery of a sum of money, to the extent that the judgment is a:
Other judgment rendered in connection with domestic relations.
A party seeking recognition of a foreign-country judgment has the burden of establishing that this subchapter applies to the foreign-country judgment.

title.text: Judgments and Executions; Fees and Costs. (Refs & Annos)
